text.0: Wundur hwār etc., 'it is a mystery where (on what occasion) aman meets death.' Cf Siev. ix 143; Aant. 40; Kock 233. See Gnom. Ex. 29 f.: Meotud āna wāt,/hwǣr se cwealm cymeþ; Gr.- Wü. ii 276.59 ff.: uncūð bið þe þænne,/tō hwan þē þīn Drihten gedōn wille,/þænne þū lengc ne mōst līfes brūcan.
